tournament.name: South American Magic Series - Regional Championship - Magicsur Chile

decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. Control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Karn, the Great Creator help disrupt the opponent's strategy while Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return provide board control. The deck's game plan is to overwhelm the opponent with massive Eldrazi threats while slowing them down with disruptive spells, ultimately leading to victory through sheer power and control.

The deck revolves around using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station to generate infinite mana and mill the opponent out. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces while Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble provide additional artifact synergy. Malevolent Rumble and Grapeshot serve as win conditions, with a backup plan involving Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The land base is designed to support the combo while also providing color fixing. Overall, the deck aims for a fast and explosive win through its combo interactions.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of targeted discard spells, counterspells, and removal. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Counterspell, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to stay ahead on board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes threats like Murktide Regent and Subtlety to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while providing flexibility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending, while also using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude. It aims to apply pressure early with aggressive creatures like Boggart Trawler and Flickerwisp, and to gain incremental advantage with cards like Ephemerate and Relic of Progenitus. The deck also has a strong graveyard hate package with cards like Relic of Progenitus. Additionally, it has a solid mana base with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure smooth mana curve.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It combines creature beatdown with direct damage spells to control the board and pressure the opponent's life total. The deck also includes some cards for disruption and card advantage. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to all colors needed for the spells in the deck. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing combos involving Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, with cards like Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble serving as key pieces for the engine. Tamiyo and Emry provide card advantage and recursion, while Urza's Saga helps fetch important artifacts. The deck features a mix of disruption and protection spells to support its game plan, aiming to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to win the game through a high-powered burst of spells and abilities.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while building a board presence with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. Using cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board, while Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd put pressure on your opponent. Ketramose, the New Dawn and Solitude provide additional threats, while Witch Enchanter and Relic of Progenitus disrupt graveyard strategies. March of Otherworldly Light provides a finisher, and Ephemerate is used for value with flicker effects. This deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control through the use of powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells, while also utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana production. With a mix of removal, hand disruption, and board wipes, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy and overpower them with big threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator. The combination of Eldrazi creatures and Tron lands allows for a versatile and resilient control strategy that can adapt to various matchups in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The key focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Doorkeeper Thrull, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu, backed up by powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. The deck also utilizes Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Consign to Memory add versatility and disruption to the aggressive strategy. The mana base is designed to support a diverse range of colors to cast the spells needed for victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to summon powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to accelerate land drops and take advantage of Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana. With cards like Scapeshift and Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly search for key combo pieces like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to opponents. The key strategy is to assemble the necessary pieces to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and lethal combos.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, leveraging the Boros color combination to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing powerful cards like Ajani, Ranger-Captain of Eos, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react defensively. With a mix of creature aggression and burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the Boros Aggro deck looks to create a fast-paced and unforgiving playstyle that can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays with creatures like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide support to the aggressive strategy. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds a powerhouse threat to the board. Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment help deal with opponent's threats efficiently. Ranger-Captain of Eos provides flexibility in searching for key creatures. Static Prison helps control the opponent's board while Thraben Charm and March of Otherworldly Light offer additional combat tricks. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast, aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to combo off and mill the opponent's library. It also includes a variety of artifacts to generate mana and card advantage, as well as control elements like Pithing Needle and Lightning Bolt for disruption. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide card selection and recursion, while Malevolent Rumble can clear the opponent's board. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on leveraging creatures with powerful enter-the-battlefield effects to disrupt opponents while applying pressure. By using cards like Fatal Push and Solitude to control the board, combined with Aether Vial to easily deploy creatures, the deck aims to maintain tempo and generate value. Ephemerate and Flickerwisp can provide additional value by repeatedly triggering powerful ETB effects, while Recruiter of the Guard helps tutor for key creatures. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while maintaining a steady stream of threats to close out the game quickly.

The deck aims to quickly generate mana through rituals and medallions to cast a large grape shot or glimpse the impossible multiple times in a turn to deal lethal damage to the opponent. It utilizes Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate storm count and draw cards, with the possibility of casting past in flames to replay spells from the graveyard. The deck also includes wish cards to tutor for specific combo pieces and Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It is a fast-paced and explosive combo deck that aims to win the game swiftly.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with unique abilities to establish a strong board presence and facilitate various combos. By using cards like Delighted Halfling, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Chord of Calling, players can quickly assemble powerful combinations to control the board and overwhelm opponents. The toolbox aspect of the deck allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups and situations, ensuring a versatile and adaptable gameplay experience. Its synergy between creatures and spells enables players to efficiently execute their game plan and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp and land search abilities to quickly assemble the powerful combo of Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and various land cards to generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelming board presence. By creating multiple copies of land cards, the deck can trigger powerful effects like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle or Green Sun's Zenith to quickly find key pieces and win the game through massive damage or overwhelming board state. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently assemble the combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play big threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. By utilizing Amulet of Vigor and other ramp spells, the deck aims to cheat out powerful creatures early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With the ability to tutor for key pieces like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures, this deck can efficiently execute its combo and overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and powerful lands.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on efficiently playing creatures and cards that deal damage directly to the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with support from cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck also includes removal options like Static Prison and Ranger-Captain of Eos to control the board while continuing to apply pressure. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride, supported by powerful spells like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thraben Charm. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ranger-Captain of Eos offer additional utility and card advantage, while Goblin Bombardment provides reach and finishers. Static Prison and Elegant Parlor help control the board, while the mana base ensures consistent casting of spells. The deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly and close out the game before they can stabilize.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ocelot Pride are the primary threats, with support from cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Guide of Souls to maintain pressure. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah can create additional creature tokens for more aggressive plays. Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide direct damage, while Static Prison can slow down opposing strategies. With a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to win through fast and relentless attacking.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, supported by powerful spells and enchantments to control the board and burn the opponent down quickly. Key cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury help generate advantage and pressure the opponent, while cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer provide card advantage and board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Static Prison to control the opponent's strategy, making it a versatile and aggressive deck in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ocelot Pride and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm your opponent. With support from cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer, you can maintain momentum and keep up the pressure. Ranger-Captain of Eos helps search for key creatures, while Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment provide removal options. Arena of Glory helps boost your creatures, while cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison can disrupt your opponent's plans. Overall, this deck aims to win swiftly through a combination of strong creatures and removal spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy revolves around playing efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, while using cards like Guide of Souls and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to pump up your creatures. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and removal options. Static Prison and Thraben Charm help control the board, while Galvanic Discharge provides removal and burn. The mana base is designed to support quick and consistent plays.

The deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach to cast multiple spells from the graveyard, along with artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and trigger abilities. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card draw and recursion. The combo potential is increased with cards like Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble, with win conditions like Grapeshot and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck is designed to quickly assemble its pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and combo interactions.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by ramping up mana quickly with Eldrazi creatures and spells like Utopia Sprawl and Talismans, while also using cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt and control the opponent's board. The deck aims to eventually cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the game. Karn, the Great Creator allows for additional utility and flexibility in utilizing artifacts. The deck utilizes a mix of ramp, control, and Eldrazi threats to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

Utilize ramp and control elements to quickly summon powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield, while disrupting and controlling opponent's resources with spells and abilities. Use accelerants like Utopia Sprawl and Devourer of Destiny to quickly build up mana for big plays, while also using Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponent's artifacts. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a game-ending threat, while Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble provide board control. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, high-powered Eldrazi creatures and disruptive control elements.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using equipment like Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe to quickly deal lethal damage to your opponent. By utilizing creatures like Ornithopter and Puresteel Paladin to attach multiple equipment at once, as well as efficient tutors like Stoneforge Mystic and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive, unblockable creature. Additionally, cards like Esper Sentinel and Battlefield Improvisation help in disrupting your opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. The strategy is to set up the combo quickly and efficiently to win the game in a few turns.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while steadily building a board presence with aggressive creatures. By combining removal spells, disruption effects, and efficient creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ketramose, the New Dawn, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and apply pressure on the opponent's life total. The use of cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp allows for additional value and flexibility in dealing with threats. The deck also utilizes the Death and Taxes strategy of taxing the opponent's resources while presenting threats of its own.

This deck's primary goal is to use various mill cards to deplete the opponent's deck as quickly as possible, eventually leading to their defeat by running out of cards. It focuses on cards that allow for mass milling, along with removal spells to control the opponent's board. It includes cards like Ruin Crab and Hedron Crab to consistently mill cards, along with Archive Trap for a powerful mill effect. The deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own win condition through milling the opponent's library.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana and cast devastating Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command while also providing card advantage with Mystic Forge. The deck's win condition comes from overwhelming the opponent with massive creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, or by using Karn, the Great Creator's abilities to lock down the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful combos. By using cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Agatha's Soul Cauldron, the deck can control the board and generate value through sacrificing and recurring creatures. The toolbox aspect of the deck is enhanced with cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith, allowing for a variety of creatures to be searched for and played at the right time. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Endurance and Malevolent Rumble to interact with the opponent's strategy.
